alert.note: Alert for Galveston (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 16 at 3:27PM CDT until May 16 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: The National Weather Service in League City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Galveston County in southeastern Texas... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 327 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southeastern League City, Texas City, Dickinson, La Marque, Santa Fe, Hitchcock, Kemah and Bacliff. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Cherry Dr and nearby streets along Benson Bayou, Hughes Lane and Deats Road along Bordens Gully, Spruce Drive at Bordens Gully, Farm to Market 517 at Gum Bayou, California Ave and lowlying streets, Pine Grove Drive at Benson Bayou, Sunset Drive at Benson Bayou, Second St at tributary to Dickinson Bayou, Dickenson Avenue at tributary to Gum Bayou, Texas Avenue at tributary to Gum Bayou, Fourth Street at Dickinson Bayou tributaries, Fourth Street at Dickinson Bayou tributary, Streets east of Caroline Street near Gum Bayou, Second St near Dickinson Bayou tributary, Mackey Drive at Gum Bayou and Deats Road at BoRoadens Gully. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
